title: Tommyknocker10
description: The Tommyknocker10 is a 10-hour endurance mtb event just outside of Silver City, NM. The trails at Ft. Bayard are super-fun, fast, and flowy with a great mixture of single and double track. All of the best descending is on single track with stream crossings, big trees, beautiful meadows, great views, and plenty of fun. The staging area has plenty of space for everyone and is in a beautiful spot. And, Silver City is an awesome town to visit, especially this time of year when things are quiet, and the weather is great.
course:
The course is about 12 miles of fun. It is a mixture of double and singletrack that is beginner-friendly.
https://www.strava.com/activities/446709846
registration:
Register at: www.ziarides.com/register

Regular reg pricing: $80 per rider – register by January 31, 2017 – t-shirt deadline

Late reg pricing: $90 per rider – register by February 21, 2017 (no t-shirt)

Juniors (under 18) and Full-time College Students:
1/2 price – college students e-mail us for code
directions: The staging area is at the Servis Coral Trailhead, just north of Ft. Bayard on USFS Road 536. A map pinpointing Ft. Bayard, which is just east of Silver City on NM 180 is here. Once you arrive at Ft. Bayard, just follow the signs to the staging area.

title: NMBRA Category C Officials Clinic
description:
Instructor: Al Watters and Pamala Thullen 
Introductory Officials Clinic: 
Albuquerque, New Mexico 
Sport Systems - 6915 Montgomery Blvd NE 
3/19/2017 – 3/19/2017 
12:00pm - 4:00pm
course:
The path to becoming an official is a one-day introductory clinic that will help you become acquainted with the roles officials play in the sport, the duties officials perform at 
a race, and the rules that are important to understand. The clinic will cover basic instruction in road, track, cyclo- 
cross and mountain bike officiating.  It is highly recommended to bring an electronic device with the 2017 USA Cycling rulebook downloaded. 
http://www.usacycling.org/usa-cycling-rule-book.htm 

At the end of the class, there is an open-book exam which will test your knowledge of basic rules and concepts. A passing score of 70% is required.
registration:
There is no charge for the clinic, but there is a license fee and a background check fee to receive a license once the course and an open-book test is successfully completed. 
Therefore, it will be helpful for you to bring a check made out to USA Cycling or a credit card number to be sent in with the application. 
Registration for this class is online at USAC.  Please register as soon as possible to allow time to acquire class materials.
directions:
Directions: 
Sport Systems - 6915 Montgomery Blvd NE, Albuquerque, New Mexico 
For More Information: 
Pamala Thullen
pamalanmcycling@gmail.com

title: Alison Dunlap Adventure Camps MTB Clinic with Pedal Queens
Tour of the Gila Fun Ride
12 Hours in the Wild West
description: 12 Hours in the Wild West is a 12 or 6-hour mountain bike event in the beautiful town of Ruidoso, NM. The race takes place on the super-fun Grindstone Lake trail system right in the heart of Ruidoso. Come spend a weekend with us in this beautiful venue.
course:
The 12 hour course will be approximately 11.6 miles with about 1200 feet of total climbing. The 6 hour course will be approximately 8 miles long with about 700 feet of climbing.

Here is the Strava Link for the 12 Hour course: https://www.strava.com/activities/512908156
registration:
Register at: www.ziarides.com/register
Early Bird: $75 per rider – register by January 31, 2017
Regular: $85 per rider – register by March 31, 2017 – t-shirt deadline
Late: $95 per rider – register by April 18, 2017 **Too late for free event t-shirt**
Juniors (under 18) and Fulltime College Students:
1/2 price – college students e-mail us for comp code
notes: Riders can sign up as solo, duos, or teams (3-4).
directions:
From mid-town Ruidoso, travel up Grindstone Canyon Rd. to Resort Drive – there are signs directing you to Grindstone Lake. The staging area is right near the Ruidoso Parks and Recreation Office:

801 Resort Dr.
Ruidoso, NM 88345.

We will also have signs directing you to the staging area, which is actually below Grindstone Lake Dam on the Frisbee Golf Course. Bring your frisbees!

title: 24 Hours in the Enchanted Forest
description: 24 Hours in the Enchanted Forest provides everything that you want from a 24 Hour Event. We have an amazing course with epic singletrack winding through meadows, pines and aspens. Seriously, the Zuni Mountains outside of Gallup, NM are a great place to ride. We have an awesome venue in the ponderosa pines with plenty of space to hang out with friends and family and hang your hammock.
course:
The course runs counter-clockwise from the McGaffey Campground, and takes riders down the really fun and fast Y2K Trail that we used to have you ride up at the end of the lap. Once we hit the intersection with Quaking Aspen trail, the course will head up familiar territory on Turkey’s Nest, Broken Nose, and Quaking Aspen to Sheet Rock Tank. From Sheet Rock Tank, we head straight on Lost Lake/Plush Trail. From here, we take the really fun Plush and Torreon Trails all the way down to the dirt road across from the McGaffey Campground. The descent down Plush and Torreon is fast and flowy with some rocky sections to keep you on your toes. This course mostly descends for the last 4-5 miles, and it’s fun!  You are welcome!

24 Hour Course Specs:
13.1 miles
Starting Elevation 7800′
Highest Elevation 8300′
Lowest Elevation 7620′
Total Climbing: 930′
registration:
Solo: Female, Male
Solo Single Speed: Female, Male
Solo Masters (50+):Female, Male
Duo: Female, Male, Co-ed, Junior Open
Teams: Female Team of 4, Male Team of 4 , Co-ed Team of 5 (Coed can also be 4), Junior Open Team of 4
Corporate: 7-10 riders
Enchantedland (beginners and juniors): 4-6 riders
Register at: http://ziarides.com/event-register/24-hours-in-the-enchanted-forest/
notes: The event is a 24 Hour Relay.
directions:
Directions to staging area/campground from I-40:

Take I-40 to New Mexico exit 33 (McGaffey/Ft. Wingate/Hwy 400)
Head south off the exit onto Highway 400.
Go about 11 miles to the USFS McGaffey Campground. The entrance to the campground will be on the right. (If you find yourself on a dirt road, you’re lost. All pavement.)
View the location on Google Maps, or see directions from Gallup.

title: Las Campanas Classic Regional Road Race Championship
description:
Las Campanas Classic New Mexico State/Regional Championship
Proceeds Benefit the Food Depot - Food Bank of Northern  New Mexico. In addition, you can bring needed canned food drive items: nonperishable canned fruit, vegetables, tuna, pop-top soups, peanut butter & pasta or $ - $1 = 4 meals. Cycling Team with most donations wins bragging rights for 2017!
course: 8.8 mile loop around the Las Campanas residential development.  Course is open for traffic and center line rule is in place.
registration: Online registration begins Monday May 29th.  Price goes up after June 20th. and online registration ends at 10:00 pm June 23rd. Late registration and number pick-up will be from 4-6 pm at BNS in Santa Fe.  we will also be distributing numbers starting at 6 am the day of the race.  All juniors will race for free.  One day licenses will be available for purchase to qualified racers. There will be no race day registration.
notes: This race is being held under USAC cycling event permit.  The award ceremony will take place at 437 Las Campanas Drive after the results have been posted and a 15 minute protest period.  USAC medals will be awarded to NMBRA members in all cats for top 3 finishers in each licensed event.  NMBRA members are residents of New Mexico or El Paso, TX.  In addition Las Campanas Classic medals will be awarded to top 3 finishers in each licensed event regardless of residency.  Restrooms and showers will be available at 437 Las Campanas Drive.  There will also be a porta-potty near the start/finish line.  Please use the provided facilities and not along the roadsides.  Thank you.  A post race lunch is included in your registration and will also take place at 437 Las Campanas Drive.  If you have any question feel free to contact Tom Egelhoff race director at 505-699-8838.  This event is being run in a joint effort of the cycling teams Bike n Sport Racing and Racing Apparel BMC.
directions: From I-25 exit 599 and Head Norh to exit and at Camino La Tierra continue to Las Campanas Drive to 437 Las Campanas Drive the headquarters of the race.  Parking will be behind 437 which will be marked with signage.

title: Angel Fire's Oso High XC Race
South Boundary BigRide
description: The South Boundary BigRide is an absolutely stunning 40 mile mostly singletrack ride from Angel Fire Resort to Taos Youth and Family Center on the South Boundary Trail. The South Boundary trail is arguably the best ride in New Mexico and probably one of the top rides in the whole country with beautiful high alpine views and amazing aspen forests. It will be a perfect warm up for those training for Leadville, as the course tops out at nearly 11,000 feet!
course: The South Boundary BigRide will be a 40 mile point to point race starting at Angel Fire Resort and ending at the Taos Youth and Family Center. The course will start in the green parking lot at Angel Fire Resort. It will end at the Taos Youth and Family Center
registration:
Categories:
Single Speed Female
Single Speed Male
Masters (50+) Female
Masters (50+) Male
Junior Female
Junior Male
Men’s Open
Women’s Open
notes: It is a point to point race with optional shuttle.
directions: The event starts at the green parking lot at Angel Fire Resort.

title: Santa Fe Hillclimb
course: 14.7 miles, 3300 foot elevation gain. Finish at the Santa Fe Ski Basin
notes: Narrow winding high elevation road. No personal follow cars. There will be a sweep vehicle.
directions: From St Francis Drive, take Paseo de Peralta east, to the intersection with Washington/Bishop's Lodge road(Look for the big pink building), turn north and then a left at the next light. That is the Fort Marcy Rec Complex, and that is the start.

title: Chubby Tire Rendezvous High Altitude Classic
Dawn 'til Dusk - 6 or 12 Hour Endurance
description: Dawn ’til Dusk is known for a few things: 100% singletrack, killer trails designed to make you want to ride more than 12 hours, ample camping and parking right on the course, laid-back atmosphere, single speed friendly, just darn friendly overall,  and well-organized. Did we mention the mind-blowingly fast and flowy singletrack?
course: This race takes place on the nationally recognized High Desert Trail System in Gallup, NM. The course follows the trail in a counter-clockwise direction. Whenever you get to an intersection, just keep following the outer loop to the right. The 12 hour course is 13 miles and the 6 hour course is 10 miles and cuts out the more difficult 3rd mesa loop descent and climb.
registration:
Categories:
12 Hour

Solo: Female, Male
Solo Single Speed: Female, Male
Solo Masters (50+): Female, Male
Duo: Female, Male, Co-ed, Junior Open
Teams: Female, Male, Co-ed, Junior Open

6 Hour

Solo: Female, Male
Solo Masters (50+): Female, Male
Duo: Junior Open
notes: This event is a relay. Most laps completed in a category wins.
directions:
There will be Zia Rides signs directing you to the venue from Highway 491 and Chino Road. Please follow them.

Take Highway 491 (exit 20) off of Interstate 40 and go North toward Shiprock.
Go North 1.8 Miles to Chino Road and turn left.
Go .2 miles just around the corner to Coal Carbon Road and turn left.
Go 1.9 miles on the dirt road to small dirt road on the left – turn left into the staging area.
You have arrived!

title: Ruidoso Peak2Peak Challenge & Outdoor Festival
description: Family friendly and multidiscipline outdoor festival that will Feature Ruidoso’s expansive World Class trail system and Downhill trail. The “Peak 2 Peak Challenge” participants (in the disciplines of Mountain biking, hiking & trail running) will trek across Five different trails, circumventing Ruidoso proper and collect custom stamps on a illustrated event Card at the summit/peak of each trail along the route, for a possible total of approximately 40 miles. During this daytime, non-race, solo guided “Fun Ride/hike” participants will be able to return at any time to the Festival grounds, that will be located at the Cedar Creek Recreation Area, where festivities will include Live Music, Kiddie races, Vendors, Food, Bike Demos, Educational booths. All registrants will be eligible for raffled prizes and other memorabilia. This event will commemorate the Official Grand Opening of the extremely popular “Cedar Creek Downhill Trail” & new Cedar Creek Trail System.

title: Ninja Mountain Bike Performance | Santa Fe (SF0902)
description: Ninja Mountain Bike Performance Skills Event
course:
Our camps are designed for the enthusiast rider or avid racer that is looking to build up and clean up their ‘toolbox’ of mountain bike skills in order to handle a variety of terrain at speed.

We will blend an in-depth version of our traditional Intermediate – Advanced skills training with coached riding sessions and several mini-seminars on hot topics like nutrition, altitude acclimatization, and the perfect bike set-up.

title: Paula Higgins Memorial 2016 Record  Challenge TT
Squash Blossom Classic - Screamer XC Mountain Bike Race
NM Spokettes Women's CX Clinic
description:
Sunday September 17, 2017
9-12am
Burton Park, Nob Hill ABQ

Who can attend: Females of all levels who want to learn basic cyclocross skills
Cost: Donations requested
Annual or one-day USAC license required
registration:
Who can attend: Females of all levels who want to learn basic cyclocross skills
Cost: Donations requested
Annual or one-day USAC license required
notes:
What Will Be Covered:
1. Dismounting & Remounting, including “3 Points of Contact”, the “Suitcase”,
and shouldering the bike: when and how
2. Cornering: How to set up for a corner, proper line choice, pairing corners
3. Off cambered cornering and sand cornering.
4. Run ups and stairs: How to negotiate these with skill and grace
5. Starts!

title: 12 Hours of Albuquerque and MTB Fest
description: The Albuquerque Mountain Bike Festival featuring the 12 Hours of Albuquerque and the 2 Hours of Albuquerque for families/beginners! We will be taking over the Oak Flat Group area just outside of Albuquerque on September 30, 2017 for a fun weekend of racing, riding, and family-friendly fun. The weekend will be full of activities with the anchor event being the 12 Hours of Albuquerque from 7am to 7pm on Saturday. We expect this race to sell out, so sign up early!
course: The course for the 12 Hours of Albuquerque is 11+ miles of fast, fun, occasionally technical, but mostly flowy singletrack in the beautiful pine forests above Albuquerque.
registration:
Categories:
Solo: Female, Male
Solo Single Speed: Female, Male
Solo Masters (50+): Female, Male
Duo: Female, Male, Co-ed, Junior Open
Teams: Female, Male, Co-ed, Junior Open
notes: The event is a relay. Those that do the most laps in a category win.
directions: Go East on I-40. From I-40 and Tramway Blvd, the distance to the Tijeras exit is about 6.5 miles. Take Exit 175 – Tijeras. On exit ramp, bear right and then enter center lane. Go straight at the stop light. This is Hwy 337. Go South on Hwy 337 8.6 miles, ascending Tijeras Canyon. Watch for the Oak Flats sign on the Right as you come up out of the canyon. Turn Left on Oak Flat Rd and go 0.9 miles. Turn Left into Oak Flat Campground.

title: Grizzly Grind
description:
Grizzly Grind 
10 Miller Ln, Angel Fire, NM 87710
Cross Country, Downhill, Dual Slalom and Short Track

Angel Fire Bike Park is the largest Bike Park in the Rocky Mountains and has been voted Best in the Southwest by MTBparks.com 3 years in a row! Come experience our 2,000+ vertical feet, 60+ miles of purpose built lift-served terrain featuring the best skinnies, jump lines, manicured flow and super chunk trails the United States has to offer.

The Lodge at Angel Fire Resort is the preferred event lodging with a special rate. 
Book online at www.angelfireresort.com 

Tent camping is available 2 blocks from Angel Fire Resort for $15/vehicle. Portable toilets will be provided.
More camping info: http://angelfirebikepark.com/camping.php
course:
Cross Country 
Start/ Finish: Near the Bike Shop which is located directly above the bottom terminal of the lift.
Course Description: There will be a starting loop that climbs under the lift line, and equals 0.9 of a mile before starting a single track climb on the main loop. For additional laps this starting loop will not be repeated. The main loop is a 2.5 mile climb and then a 2.1mile descent totaling the 4.6 mile lap. The main loop will climb Trail 37 (Enlightenment) past Hub C to Trail 3 (Sierra). Descend Trail 3 to Hub F. At Hub F descend Trail 11 (Lower Boogie) to the Start/Finish. 
Dual Slalom 
Location: Red Zone 34 on the Angel Fire map. From the base area look uphill to the right and you will see a brown shack. The Dual Slalom is to the right of the shack.
 Course Description: A great course with huge berms and blind tables! Here is a good satellite view of the course. https://www.google.com/maps/@36.3837497,-105.2691701,838a,20y,180h/data=!3m1!1e3 

Short Track 
All except Men A- 
Start/Finish for ALL except Mens A: Near the Bike Shop which is located directly above the bottom terminal of the Chile Express lift.
Start/Finish for Mens A: on N Angel Fire Rd (going uphill) after the stairs section of the course.
Course Description:  From the Chile Express Lift, descend grassy area near the magic carpet to the upper base area. Descend wood stairs (covered with plywood) through the upper base area. Turn right to climb N Angel Fire Rd (paved). Continue to climb onto and through the dirt parking area past The Sunset Grill (on left) onto Enlightenment Trail. Climb Enlightenment for about 650ft then a right turn onto an old double track to bring you onto Chile Express under the Chile Express Lift. Descend Chile Express back to start/finish.
Down Hill
Location: From the top of the lift exit to the right and descend Trail 1 (Easy Street) about 0.6 of a mile to the top of Trail 25 (World Cup).
Course Description: Trail 25 - World Cup.  Contains hazardous sections. All racers are strongly encouraged to preview the course!!

Go to www.angelfireresort.com/activities/summer-activities/bike-park/
for course details
registration:
USAC license required. USAC license required.

Riders must have race plates on bikes at all times when on the race courses.

Entry Fees:
•	$26 per rider per one event. 
•	$46 for two events.
•	$56 for three or more events. 



Lift Tickets: $20/day and can be purchased at the ticket office. Take race plate when purchasing lift ticket.

Results:
Results for all events will be posted ASAP at the Angel Fire Bike Shop.

Awards
Leader Jerseys will be awarded to male and female Category A conference champions. Awards ceremony to take place following Downhill on Sunday. Ceremony will be held on the deck at the resort.
notes:
Saturday, Oct. 8th 2015	
XC Cross Country
•	Men A: 9:00 am 4 laps 
•	Men B: 9:05 am 3 laps 
•	Women A: 9:10 am 3 laps 
•	Men C: 9:15 am 1 lap 
•	Women B: 9:20 am 1 lap
Start: On paved road near the lodge, below bike shop.
Finish: Near Bike Shop 

Dual Slalom
Practice: 9:00 am - 1:00 pm (gate operating later half of practice)	
Dual Slalom: Start Time 1:30 pm
Location: The Dual Slalom course is located at Red Zone 34 on the Angel Fire map. From the base area look uphill to the right and you will see a brown shack. The Dual Slalom is to the right of the shack.	
•	Women B
•	Women A
•	Men C
•	Men B
•	Men A

STXC Cross Country Short Track
Start/Finish: Near the Bike Shop which is located directly above the bottom terminal of the lift. Men A will start/finish at the opposite side of the shop on N Angel Fire Rd.
•	Women B: 8:00 am (15 min + 1 lap)
•	Men C: 8:30 am (15 min + 1 lap)

DH Down Hill
Start Time: First rider off at 11:45 am
DH Practice: 9:00 am-4:00 pm	DH Practice 9 am- 10:30 am
Location: From the top of the lift exit to the right and descend Trail 1 (Easy Street) about 0.6 of a mile to the top of Trail 24 (World Cup).

•	Women B

Note: There will be 1 min gap between racers.  5 min gap between categories.
directions:

Angel Fire Resort 
10 Miller Ln, Angel Fire, NM 87710

title: CycloCross at Glorieta Camps Produced by CORE Crew
Fiesta CX race presented by Sport Systems
New Mexico Four Corners Regional Cyclocross Championship
